value.0: Do you seek passage across the Dark River? There is no other who can guide you safely. Those who try have all drowned, and their bones have since been swept away.
I am bound to the Dark River, the flowing waters wash away all wound and harm. You cannot hurt me here while the river's currents lap against my vessel's hull.
I know much about the river's black waters, I know something of the islands these waters surround. But about your world - the world of earth and dry land - I know little.
You seek to destroy the Valsharess; her death is your release. I can help you with this. I know the secrets of the islands; the Dark River whispers them to me when I glide across her waters.
Then you are wise, for you know nothing of what lurks within the depths of my heart. But I alone can take you to the islands you must visit if you wish to defeat the Valsharess.
The soul of the Valsharess is black and cold. She hungers to conquer, she yearns to rule every inch of every corner of the Underdark. Even the wild currents of the Dark River.
Her power is growing, and soon she will enslave the Dark River itself, bending its untamed waters to her whims and will. That cannot happen. That is why I will take you to the islands.
The soul of the Valsharess is black and cold. She hungers to conquer, she yearns to rule every inch of every corner of the Underdark. Even the wild currents of the Dark River.
Her power is growing, and soon she will enslave the Dark River itself, bending its untamed waters to her whims and will. That cannot happen. That is why I will take you to the islands.
I am Cavallas of the Dark River. I am navigator, guide and keeper of its secrets. And I alone can take you to the islands you must visit.
I am... something else. I can take you across the Dark River, and to the islands you must visit if you wish to destroy the Valsharess. More than this you do not need to know.
The islands of the Dark River are places of secrets; places of power and danger. In these places you might find something to aid you against the Valsharess and her great army.
But though there are many tiny islands, there are two of particular note: the Isle of the Maker, and an island that is now home to a strange town that appeared from nowhere.
For many centuries that island was deserted. Then suddenly a small settlement appeared overnight. But this is no ordinary Underdark city: the creatures there are from the surface.
They are cousins of the drow; elves, you surfacers call them. But they have wings. Such creatures are not normally found down here. They avoid contact with me... though they may speak with you.
They are cousins of the drow; elven, like you surfacer. But they have wings. Such creatures are not normally found down here. They avoid contact with me... though they may speak with you.
But there is something else on the island, as well. Something magical. I can feel its power as my boat floats by the shores, though its exact nature is hidden from me.
I suspect this magic is the source of the town's strange appearance. If you could harness such power you could use it against the Valsharess.
The Isle of the Maker is the home of an ancient duergar sorcerer. The Maker has not been seen for many centuries, yet his creations - the golems - still wander the island.
If you could find the Maker you might convince him to lend his golems to your cause. Or, if the Maker is no more, you might find a way to control his creations.
More than this I cannot tell you, as I have never actually landed on the Isle of the Maker. It is a duergar island, and I am not welcome there.

They are cousins of the drow; elves, you surfacers call them. But they have wings. Such creatures are not normally found down here. They avoid contact with me... though they may speak with you.

But there is something else on the island, as well. Something magical. I can feel its power as my boat floats by the shores, though its exact nature is hidden from me.
I suspect this magic is the source of the town's strange appearance. If you could harness such power you could use it against the Valsharess.
Which island do you wish to know about: the Isle of the Maker, or the strange town that appeared from nowhere?
For many centuries that island was deserted. Then suddenly a small settlement appeared overnight. But this is no ordinary Underdark city: the creatures there are from the surface.
They are cousins of the drow; elves, you surfacers call them. But they have wings. Such creatures are not normally found down here. They avoid contact with me... though they may speak with you.

But there is something else on the island, as well. Something magical. I can feel its power as my boat floats by the shores, though its exact nature is hidden from me.
I suspect this magic is the source of the town's strange appearance. If you could harness such power you could use it against the Valsharess.
The Isle of the Maker is the home of an ancient duergar sorcerer. The Maker has not been seen for many centuries, yet his creations - the golems - still wander the island.
If you could find the Maker you might convince him to lend his golems to your cause. Or, if the Maker is no more, you might find a way to control his creations.
More than this I cannot tell you, as I have never actually landed on the Isle of the Maker. It is a duergar island, and I am not welcome there.
I alone can take you across the Dark River to the islands beyond, but first you must know something about your destination.
Then I alone can take you. No other guide can safely navigate the Dark River. Where do you wish to go?
As you wish.
As you wish.
I'll be going now.
Die, you freak!
Can I ask you some questions?
I need help against the Valsharess.
I don't trust you.
Why are you helping me?
Why are you helping me?
What are you?
I want to ask you something else.
Are you a drow? A duergar? Something else?
Tell me about these islands.
Tell me about this strange town.
Tell me about the Isle of the Maker.
Tell me about the Isle of the Maker.
Tell me about this strange town.
I want to ask you something else.
Tell me about this strange town.
Tell me about the Isle of the Maker.
I need passage across the river.
Take me to the Isle of the Maker.
Take me to the island with the strange town.
Take me back to the Seer's camp.
